description: From Middle French victime, from Latin victima (“sacrificial animal”).

definitionGroups.group: One that is harmed—killed, injured, subjected to oppression, deceived, or otherwise adversely affected—by someone or something, especially another person or event, force, or condition; in particular:

entries.meaning: One who is harmed or killed by a crime or scam.
examples: victims of assault; the murderer's victims
became another victim of the latest scam

entries.meaning: One who is harmed or killed by an accident or illness.
examples: a fundraiser for victims of AIDS; a victim of a car crash

entries.meaning: One who is harmed or killed as a result of other people's biases, emotions or incompetence, or their own.
examples: a victim of his own pride; a victim of her own incompetence
the newcomer never managed to make friends, a victim of the town's deep distrust of outsiders
a victim of sexism; victims of a racist system

entries.meaning: One who is harmed or killed as a result of a natural or man-made disaster or impersonal condition.
examples: relief efforts to help victims of the hurricane
victim of an optical illusion; victim of a string of bad luck
local businesses were the main victims of the economic downturn

definitionGroups.group: A living being which is slain and offered as a sacrifice, usually in a religious rite.

entries.meaning: (by extension, Christianity) The transfigured body and blood of Christ in the Eucharist.
